support_summary: The E3 ubiquitin ligase AMFR (also known as Gp78) directly interacts with and polyubiquitinates ATXN3. This ubiquitination targets ATXN3 for degradation through the Endoplasmic Reticulum-Associated Degradation (ERAD) pathway, playing a role in the quality control and turnover of ATXN3.

functions.cellular_process: The E3 ubiquitin ligase AMFR (gp78), an enzyme involved in Endoplasmic Reticulum-Associated Degradation (ERAD), directly interacts with and polyubiquitinates ATXN3.
functions.effect_description: AMFR-mediated ubiquitination targets ATXN3 for proteasomal degradation via the ERAD pathway, thereby reducing its protein levels.
biological_consequence: AMFR (E3 ligase) binds ATXN3 → AMFR polyubiquitinates ATXN3 → ATXN3 is targeted for Endoplasmic Reticulum-Associated Degradation (ERAD) → Proteasomal degradation of ATXN3 protein → Decreased ATXN3 protein stability.
specific_effects: Overexpression of gp78 promotes the ubiquitination and degradation of ATXN3.
Knockdown of gp78 stabilizes ATXN3 protein.
The E3 ligase activity of gp78 is critical for the degradation of ataxin-3.

evidence.paper_title: Gp78, an ER associated E3, promotes SOD1 and ataxin-3 degradation
evidence.authors: Ying Z, Wang H, Fan H, Zhu X, Zhou J, Fei E, Wang G.
evidence.assay: Co-immunoprecipitation, Western blotting, in vivo ubiquitination assay
evidence.relevant_quote: Overexpression of gp78 promotes the ubiquitination and degradation of these two proteins [SOD1 and ataxin-3], whereas knockdown of gp78 stabilizes them.

mechanism: The E3 ubiquitin ligase AMFR (gp78), an enzyme involved in Endoplasmic Reticulum-Associated Degradation (ERAD), directly interacts with and polyubiquitinates ATXN3.
effect: AMFR-mediated ubiquitination targets ATXN3 for proteasomal degradation via the ERAD pathway, thereby reducing its protein levels.
summary: ATXN3 inhibits AMFR to modulate atxn3 protein stability, ultimately affecting decreased atxn3 protein stability.

evidence.paper_title: Gp78, an ER associated E3, promotes SOD1 and ataxin-3 degradation
evidence.authors: Ying Z, Wang H, Fan H, Zhu X, Zhou J, Fei E, Wang G.
evidence.assay: Co-immunoprecipitation, Western blotting, in vivo ubiquitination assay
evidence.relevant_quote: Overexpression of gp78 promotes the ubiquitination and degradation of these two proteins [SOD1 and ataxin-3], whereas knockdown of gp78 stabilizes them.
